question:
You are going on a short training course at a college in Greeemount, Northern Ireland. You need somewhere to live while you are there.
Write a letter to the accommodation officer at the college. In your letter
-explain your situation
-describe the accomodation you require
-say when you will need it
text: I am writing to you regarding your fortnightly course “Fundamentals of Python” arrange  for professionals starting from the 14th of March, which I have registered as a participant.

I am travelling from Bangladesh, and Ireland is an unknown place to me where I do not have any friends or families that I know. Consequently, my need  for accommodation is a top priority, which can be solved by you according to my  understanding.

About my accommodation, my flat requirement is pretty basic for a short-term of 15 days, which can be extended  up to a month. In addition, I would love to have a separate bath, although the kitchen can be shared. The flat must be located in a place where all sorts of communication are available.

My arrival date is on the 12th of March; therefore, you can book a flat for the rest of the month in my view. Any advance or deposit will be paid according to the terms & conditions after the online visit of the flat.
